qas.question: What country did Hayek move to in 1962?
What is the name of the book Hayek started upon his arrival in West Germany?
Where did Hayek spend an entire year after his retirement?
When was the final volume of Law, Legislation and Liberty released?
During his time in Los Angeles, what was the topic of the seminars Hayek taught not related to his new book?

context: From 1962 until his retirement in 1968, he was a professor at the University of Freiburg, <a0_0>West Germany<a0_0/>, where he began work on his next book, <a1_0>Law, Legislation and Liberty<a1_0/>. Hayek regarded his years at Freiburg as "very fruitful". Following his retirement, Hayek spent a year as a visiting professor of philosophy at the <a2_0>University of California, Los Angeles<a2_0/>, where he continued work on Law, Legislation and Liberty, teaching a graduate seminar by the same name and another on the <a4_0>philosophy of social science<a4_0/>. Primary drafts of the book were completed by 1970, but Hayek chose to rework his drafts and finally brought the book to publication in three volumes in 1973, 1976 and <a3_0>1979<a3_0/>.
